user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_quiesce_daemon:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN MHD_socket
MHD_quiesce_daemon (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  unsigned int i;
#endif
  MHD_socket ret;

  ret = daemon->listen_fd;
  if ((MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == ret)
      || daemon->was_quiesced)
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  if ( (0 == (daemon->options & (MHD_USE_ITC))) &&
       MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Using MHD_quiesce_daemon in this mode " \
                 "requires MHD_USE_ITC.\n"));
#endif
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  }

#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  if (NULL != daemon->worker_pool)
    for (i = 0; i < daemon->worker_pool_size; i++)
    {
      daemon->worker_pool[i].was_quiesced = true;
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
      if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
          (-1 != daemon->worker_pool[i].epoll_fd) &&
          (daemon->worker_pool[i].listen_socket_in_epoll) )
      {
        if (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->worker_pool[i].epoll_fd,
                            EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                            ret,
                            NULL))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n"));
        daemon->worker_pool[i].listen_socket_in_epoll = false;
      }
      else
#endif
      if (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc))
      {
        if (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->worker_pool[i].itc, "q"))
          MHD_PANIC (_ ("Failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                        "communication channel.\n"));
      }
    }
#endif
  daemon->was_quiesced = true;
#ifdef EPOLL_SUPPORT
  if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
      (-1 != daemon->epoll_fd) &&
      (daemon->listen_socket_in_epoll) )
  {
    if ( (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->epoll_fd,
                          EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                          ret,
                          NULL)) &&
         (ENOENT != errno) )   /* ENOENT can happen due to race with
                                  #MHD_epoll() */
      MHD_PANIC ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n");
    daemon->listen_socket_in_epoll = false;
  }
#endif
  if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "q")) )
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                  "communication channel.\n"));
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_quiesce_daemon:
#define MHD_PANIC(msg) do{mhd_panic(mhd_panic_cls,__FILE__,__LINE__,msg);BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED;}while(0)
...
void
MHD_DLOG (const struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
          const char *format,
          ...)
{
  va_list va;

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_USE_ERROR_LOG))
    return;
  va_start (va, format);
  daemon->custom_error_log (daemon->custom_error_log_cls,
                            format,
                            va);
  va_end (va);
}
...
#define MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_(itc) (-1!=((itc).fd))
...
#define MHD_itc_activate_(itc, str) ((write((itc).fd,(constvoid*)&_MHD_itc_wr_data,sizeof(_MHD_itc_wr_data))>0)||(EAGAIN==errno))
...
#define MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_(d) (0!=((d)->options&MHD_USE_EPOLL))
...
#define MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_(d) (0!=(d->options&(MHD_USE_INTERNAL_POLLING_THREAD)))
...
#define MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS 1
...
#define EPOLL_SUPPORT 1
...
#define HAVE_MESSAGES 1
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
if ( (0 != epoll_ctl (daemon->epoll_fd,
                          EPOLL_CTL_DEL,
                          ret,
                          NULL)) &&
         (ENOENT != errno) )   /* ENOENT can happen due to race with
                                  #MHD_epoll() */
      MHD_PANIC ("Failed to remove listen FD from epoll set.\n");

if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "q")) )
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("failed to signal quiesce via inter-thread " \
                  "communication channel.\n"));
explanation:
I selected the fragments above for investigation because each contains a call to MHD_PANIC (a macro defined to call mhd_panic and then contain BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED), or involves preprocessor-conditioned branching where an else/endif pairing may produce different control-flow shapes depending on configuration. Since MHD_PANIC is intended as a no-return path (BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED), calls to it can create code paths that are declared unreachable; these locations must be reviewed to ensure no statically unreachable statements remain in the function (MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1). The EPOLL_SUPPORT/else/#endif construct is also flagged because conditional compilation can make portions of the code unreachable or alter the syntactic pairing of if/else in other configurations — it should be checked that no unreachable fragments arise when different feature macros are set or unset.

Why other fragments were not selected: most other branches in the function are ordinary runtime conditionals (if ((MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == ret) || daemon->was_quiesced) return ...; checks of daemon->options bits; loop over worker_pool; early returns and assignments) — these are not inherently statically unreachable and are intended runtime control flow. The MHD_itc activation macro and MHD_DLOG path are runtime expressions/guards (their results depend on runtime state or options bits) and do not introduce compile-time unreachable code by themselves. The guarded declarations and code under feature #if blocks that are present in the provided project configuration (MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS, EPOLL_SUPPORT, HAVE_MESSAGES defined) are compiled in and thus not unreachable for this build; only the locations listed above involve explicit no-return semantics or conditional compilation patterns that could produce unreachable code and therefore require investigation.
